result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael M Johnson

records.addlTxt: Motion Order to Seal Victim Impact Statement, Signed by Judge Carter on 10/17/2022
Motion Order to Seal Victim Impact Statement

9:02 AM Attorney Austin E. Simarski in court for Michael M Johnson. Attorney appears by authorization.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense believes there is a resolution with the State, and requests a plea/sentencing date. Court sets.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:35 AM Defendant Michael M Johnson in court. Attorney appears by authorization. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense was recently retained, and requests more time to review discovery and offer. 
State requests to be advised if proceeding to plea/sentence to allow for victim notification.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Atty Simarski appears on behalf of the Defendant, Michael M Johnson
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with individual listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

09:37 AM Defendant Michael M Johnson in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant to seek counsel.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on July 14th, 2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
